Package com.jimmyselectronics.abagnale

Interface IReceiptPrinter

All Known Implementing Classes:
ReceiptPrinterND
public interface IReceiptPrinter
Represents receipt printers without specifying the implementation details.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addInk(int quantity)
    Adds ink to the printer.
    void

    Adds paper to the printer.
    void

    Prints a single character to the receipt.

  • Method Details

    • print

      void print(char c) throws EmptyException, OverloadException
      Prints a single character to the receipt. Whitespace characters are ignored, with the exception of ' ' (blank) and '\n', which signals to move to the start of the next line. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      c - The character to print.
      Throws:
      EmptyException - If there is no ink or no paper in the printer.
      OverloadException - If the extra character would spill off the end of the line.

    • cutPaper

      void cutPaper()
      The receipt is finished printing, so cut it so that the customer can easily remove it. Failure to cut the paper means that the receipt will not be retrievable by the customer. Requires power.

    • removeReceipt

      String removeReceipt()
      Simulates the customer removing the receipt. Failure to cut the receipt first, or to always remove the receipt means that the customer will end up with other customers' receipts too! Does not require power.
      Returns:
      The receipt if it has been cut; otherwise, null.

    • addInk

      void addInk(int quantity) throws OverloadException
      Adds ink to the printer. Simulates a human doing the adding. On success, announces "inkAdded" event. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      quantity - The quantity of characters-worth of ink to add.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If the quantity is negative.
      OverloadException - If the total of the existing ink plus the added quantity is greater than the printer's capacity.

    • addPaper

      void addPaper(int units) throws OverloadException
      Adds paper to the printer. Simulates a human doing the adding. On success, announces "paperAdded" event. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      units - The quantity of lines-worth of paper to add.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If the quantity is negative.
      OverloadException - If the total of the existing paper plus the added quantity is greater than the printer's capacity.
